articles.title: New light-based chip pushes AI tasks 100-fold while cutting electricity use
articles.author: Aamir Khollam
articles.summary: Researchers at the University of Florida have developed a chip that uses light to perform one of AI's most demanding tasks. The team integrated optical components directly onto a silicon chip. Laser light and microscopic lenses carry out convolutions faster and with lower energy needs. The prototype classified handwritten digits with about 98 percent accuracy.

articles.title: Florida team builds chip to run AI tasks 100-fold at lower power cost
articles.author: Aamir Khollam
articles.summary: Researchers at the University of Florida have developed a new chip that uses light to power AI. The chip is built to handle convolution operations, a core function in machine learning. It uses laser light and microscopic lenses to carry out convolutions faster and with lower energy needs. It classified handwritten digits with 98% accuracy.

articles.title: Pikurate Turns Digital History Into a Living Memory AI
articles.author: Get News
articles.summary: Pikurate is able to provide an answer because it remembers and understands your own history. It is currently in a two-year closed beta period and users have to wait for it to be available to the general public. It will be available in the near future.

articles.title: Botsify Launches AI-Powered Agentic Platform for building AI Agents
articles.author: Get News
articles.summary: Botsify has announced the official launch of its new agentic platform replacing its legacy drag-and-drop chatbot builder. The updated platform introduces a conversational interface that allows users to build, deploy, and manage AI agents. Botsify is a company specializing in conversational AI.

articles.title: The A.I. bubble can result in a stock market crash as a result of over-hyped stock valuations,
articles.summary: Ishkur, Fallingcow and Dave2042 are against AI. Fallingcow has worked with AI for the last two years and knows how bad it is. He thinks the beliefs of the anti-AI people like Marcus, Hutchins and Gary Marcus are a bubble.

articles.title: AI Companion Robot Says Hello To Japan's 36 Million Seniors
articles.author: Gil Press
articles.summary: Kanematsu Corporation and Intuition Robotics announce a partnership to co-develop a Japanese market version of ElliQ, an AI companion robot for older adults. Kanematsu invested $85 million in the company. The number of people in Japan aged 65 and over is growing.

articles.title: HSBC Sees Apple at $220 as Investors Eye Tomorrow's iPhone 17 Reveal
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: HSBC analyst Erwan Rambourg reiterated a Hold rating on the stock with a $220.00 price target. The rating comes ahead of the tech giant's upcoming product launch event on September 9. Apple is a technology company known for its consumer electronics, software and services.

articles.title: Is Hong Kong doing enough to achieve its smart tourism goals? No, experts say
articles.author: South China Morning Post
articles.summary: Low AI literacy and slow adoption of new technology in Hong Kong's tourism industry may be holding the city back from realising its full potential as a world-class destination. In 2024, the Hong Kong government launched its 'Development Blueprint for the Tourism Industry 2.0'.

articles.title: Preparing your workforce for the AI revolution
articles.author: Juanita Vorster
articles.summary: In the boardroom, risk management is called resilience. In HR, it's risk management. In marketing it's futureproofing. What people really want is accurate predictions on what is going to change and solutions on how to delay or prevent the impact of that change. To effectively respond to looming change, knowledge workers and their employers don't need more predictions. They need to buckle down and get to work. Training and professional development plans for knowledge-based workforces must incorporate critical thinking, ethical reasoning and clear communication. Policy making processes should focus on creating policies that enable a new way of work.

articles.title: An AI Copilot Quadrupled the Performance of This Wearable Brain-Reading Device
articles.author: Edd Gent
articles.summary: New research shows that AI and brain-computer interfaces could provide another promising direction for the development of brain implants. University of California, Los Angeles researchers used a cap with 64 electrodes to capture electroencephalography, or EEG, signals. They developed a custom algorithm to decode these signals and combined it with AI copilots for specific tasks. The system was tested by four study participants, one of whom was paralyzed from the waist down.

articles.title: AI feature Annie made by AI, next May, Cannes Film Festival
articles.author: Marina Collins
articles.summary: OpenAI is producing a full-length animated feature film, 'Critterz,' using AI tools. It's aiming for a debut at the Cannes Film Festival in May of next year. The project is a proof of concept that AI can create movies faster and cheaper than traditional Hollywood methods.

articles.title: Goldman Sachs analyst bets AI will give software companies a 'rebirth'
articles.author: Francisco Velasquez
articles.summary: Kash Rangan believes AI is going to be a force multiplier for software. He likes SaaS companies like Salesforce (CRM) and ServiceNow (NOW). CoreWeave (CRWV) is a high-leveraged bet on the AI infrastructure theme.

articles.title: UK insurers face 'data quality' obstacles in AI adoption
articles.author: City AM
articles.summary: Poor quality data is preventing British insurers from accelerating AI adoption. Nearly three quarters of underwriters identified fragmented and unstructured data as the primary barrier to AI transformation. The next top challenge was accurate risk assessment, cited by 42 percent, and pricing, by CI&T.

articles.title: Atolio Raises $24M in Total Funding to Scale Private AI-Powered Enterprise Search
articles.summary: Atolio, the private AI-powered platform for enterprise search, has closed its Series A led by Translink Capital with participation from IBM Ventures, Bloomberg Beta, Acorn Pacific Ventures, and Parameter Ventures. Since its founding in 2019, Atolio has deployed its fully-private solution to leading enterprises across industries and won multiple seven-figure contracts in the past three quarters alone.

articles.title: Atolio Raises $24M in Total Funding to Scale Private AI-Powered Enterprise Search
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: Atolio, the private AI-powered platform for enterprise search, has closed its Series A led by Translink Capital with participation from IBM Ventures, Bloomberg Beta, Acorn Pacific Ventures, and Parameter Ventures. Atolio is a venture backed by IBM Ventures.

articles.title: The AI Advantage: How Hutfin Is Revolutionizing Smarter CRE Decisions
articles.author: Get News
articles.summary: In today's economy, data is more valuable than ever and AI is positioning itself as a trusted ally for commercial real estate stakeholders. Harnessing AI in CRE isn't just about automating tasks, it's about creating intelligence that amplifies human expertise.

articles.title: California, Delaware AGs warn OpenAI over ChatGPT safety
articles.author: Marc Lutz
articles.summary: California and Delaware AGs have 'serious concerns' about the safety of OpenAI's ChatGPT chatbot, especially for children and teens. They are concerned by tragic teen deaths linked to chatbot interactions. The parents of the 16-year-old California boy who died in April sued OpenAI and its CEO, Sam Altman, last month.

articles.title: The DuckDuckGo AI Option — Goforth Solutions, LLC
articles.author: Becoming
articles.summary: DuckDuckGo acts as a middleman between the AI companies and the chatbot. ChatGPT, Claude or Llama technology within DuckDuckgo's chatbot limits what AI companies know about you and what you're chatting about. Your conversations are saved only anonymously for 30 days. AI companies don't use your conversations to train AI.

articles.title: MOSI Opens Eye-opening New AI Exhibit This September
articles.author: Staff Report
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence: Your Mind & The Machine is a hands-on exhibit at MOSI, Tampa's Museum of Science & Industry. It's the first of its kind to explore the real impact of artificial intelligence and how it's shaping how people live, work, and learn.

articles.title: AVATR VISION XPECTRA Makes Global Debut, AVATR Original Design Aesthetics Captivate Munich
articles.author: The Arabian Post
articles.summary: AVATR Technology hosted the Brand Day: A Brilliant New Horizon at UTOPIA M�nchen and unveiled the world's first emotional intelligence (EI) concept car, AVATR VISION XPECTRA. The event also featured the limited-edition AVatR 012.

articles.title: Young People Drive Ai in Tourism, but Boomer Growth Is Surprising
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence in the tourism sector has gone from being a technological promise to becoming a decisive factor for competitiveness. More than half of Spanish hoteliers consider that AI-based search and customization tools will reshape the industry in the coming years, compared to 40% who believe it won't.

articles.title: Ghastly Smartest (0) Funniest (0) ‘' 12 minutes ago
articles.summary: I had problems with YouTube's AI moderation over a year ago. I eventually gave up and edited the thumbnail once I identified what the AI bot was flagging as inappropriate. I believe the AI will lead to a dystopian future as it's impossible to control it.

articles.title: Community-Validated Ultimate Blueprint Generator Empowers Everyone to Build Gameplay in Unreal Engine 5
articles.author: Get News
articles.summary: Ultimate Blueprint Generator is an AI-powered development environment. It has an impressive 4.7 out of 5-star rating on the Unreal Engine Marketplace (FAB). It's a tool designed to empower not only seasoned developers but also beginners. The community response has been overwhelmingly positive.

articles.title: Meet the ex-Biden appointee who could be major force against Trump's AI agenda: 'Doomsayer'
articles.author: Andrew Mark Miller
articles.summary: Trump signed an executive order earlier this year titled, "Removing Barriers to American Leadership in Artificial Intelligence." This week he met with top technology industry leaders, including Mark Zuckerburg, Bill Gates and others at the White House. Jason Matheny, a former senior Biden official and the CEO of the RAND Corporation, is a leader in the effective altruism movement, which seeks to regulate the development of artificial intelligence and reduce its risks.

articles.title: Did AI robot suffer PTSD after it was scared by lion?
articles.author: Snopes
articles.summary: There is no evidence that the story about an AI robot fearing a lion was real. An image shared with the claim in September 2025 was AI-generated and it's not clear if the story is true.       i.e. the claim is false.

articles.title: AP Technology SummaryBrief at 5:34 p.m. EDT
articles.summary: Police in Nepal's capital of Kathmandu opened fire on protesters, killing at least 17 people. Undersea cable cuts in the Red Sea have disrupted internet access in Asia and the Mideast. Warner Bros. is suing the AI company Midjourney for copyright infringement. Google was hit with a $3.5 billion fine from the European Union for antitrust violations.

articles.title: More than half of consumers are wary of AI-powered search: Gartner
articles.summary: 61% of consumers would like to turn off AI summaries in their search results.    i.e. artificial intelligence is impacting how they search for products and services, and 61% of people wish they could turn it off in their searches.

articles.title: Google AI Mode: Pioneering Multilingual Search with Five New Languages
articles.author: Bitcoin World
articles.summary: Google has expanded Google AI Mode to five new languages. It's a significant milestone for cryptocurrency enthusiasts.    Google's AI Mode allows people to ask complex questions in their preferred language and explore the web more deeply in their chosen language. Google's latest move is significant for information and global access.

articles.title: Push for councils to embrace new road monitoring tech in $10 billion issue
articles.author: Nick Whigham
articles.summary: Monash University in Melbourne is trialling a new technology to monitor road quality using sensors, accelerometer, gyroscope, GPS and "machine learning" to map out potholes. Government spends about $30 billion per year on road maintenance, including 20 to 40% of the nation's road network.

articles.title: Aussie innovation to help smooth over growing $10 billion road problem: 'It bothers me'
articles.author: Nick Whigham
articles.summary: Monash University in Melbourne has been trialling a new technology to monitor road quality using sensors, accelerometer, gyroscope, GPS and "machine learning" software. They hope to roll out the technology to existing fleets of public vehicles. Government spends about $30 billion per year on road maintenance.

articles.title: ASML Bets Big on Mistral AI in $2 Billion Round
articles.author: Undercovered Deep Insights
articles.summary: ASML is about to make a big move into artificial intelligence. The Dutch chip equipment maker is preparing to pour $1.5 billion into French startup Mistral AI's latest fundraising. The investment would anchor Mistral's $2 billion Series C round and give ASML both a major equity stake and a board seat. The deal would value Mistral at about $11 billion.

articles.title: OpenAI backs AI-animated film for Cannes debut
articles.author: AFP AFP
articles.summary: ChatGPT-maker OpenAI is backing the production of a feature-length animated film created largely with artificial intelligence tools. The movie, titled "Critterz," follows woodland creatures on an adventure after their village is disrupted by a stranger. It's hoped to premiere at the Cannes Film Festival in May 2026 before a global theatrical release.

articles.title: Programmers Using AI Create Way More Glaring Security Issues, Data Shows
articles.summary: Security firm Apiiro found that developers who use AI produce ten times more security problems than their counterparts who don't use the technology. Some of the "benefits" of AI coding appear to be the vehicles for these issues. Privilege escalation, or code that allows an attacker to get higher access to a system than they should, increased by 322%. Architectural design problems were up 153%.

articles.title: Bot Or Bust: Klarna's IPO Punts On AI Future – Should Banks Follow?
articles.author: Christer Holloman
articles.summary: Klarna's IPO is one of the most closely watched IPOs in fintech. The company's chatbot, Klarna, handles the majority of its customer service interactions. CEO Sebastian Siemiatkowski is trying to prove that financial institutions weighed down by low margins, high headcounts, and legacy costs can be re-engineered into lean, high-efficiency technology platforms.

articles.title: Exclusive: Zoho backs smaller enterprise LLMs for AI future
articles.author: IT Brief Australia
articles.summary: Zoho unveils domain-specific AI models focused on enterprise productivity, privacy and cost control. It is steering clear of general-purpose chatbots, however, as it does not want to compete with chatbots in the current market.    for more information, visit zoho.com.

articles.title: Why Analysts Call Broadcom a 'Magnificent Eight' Stock That Can Challenge Nvidia
articles.author: Kara Greenberg
articles.summary: Strong quarterly results from Broadcom could signal strong competition for AI heavyweight Nvidia. Melius Research analysts see Broadcom and Nvidia as potential winners of the rapidly growing AI computing and networking market. They see both stocks more than doubling in value in the next three years.

articles.title: Colleges Race To Prepare Students For The AI Workplace
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Universities race to prepare students for the AI workplace, teaching generative AI skills, strategic AI literacy, and future workforce training as entry-level jobs vanish.    .      in this way, they are preparing students to work in the future AI workplace.

articles.title: AI will consume all of IT by 2030—but not all IT jobs, Gartner says
articles.author: Ars Technica
articles.summary: In five years, you won't be able to spell IT without AI, according to Gartner's VP analysts Alicia Mullery and Daryl Plummer. They delivered the sentiment at their keynote address at the IT Symposium in Gold Coast, Australia today.

articles.title: What You Need to Know on Monday? Reshuffle Wednesday, Crisis in France and Artificial Intelligence
articles.author: La Presse
articles.summary: What You Need to Know on Monday is the Reshuffle Wednesday, Crisis in France and Artificial Intelligence.    i.e. the crisis in France, the reshuffle on Wednesday, and the artificial intelligence crisis in this week's What You Need To Know.

articles.title: Unveiling the Future: AI Breakthroughs Driven by Smarter Search at Bitcoin World Disrupt 2025
articles.author: Bitcoin World
articles.summary: The world of cryptocurrency thrives on innovation, decentralization and the efficient management of vast, complex data. Much like blockchain technology revolutionized how we secure and transact information, artificial intelligence is revolutionizing the way we manage data and information is stored and transferred.

articles.title: Will our warrantless Masked Military Sheriff/Police get sacked?
articles.author: Juxtaposition1
articles.summary: Ring Cameras, Smart Meters, LED streetlights, CubeSats, HIVE Architecture, Multi-Hop Networks and SMART DUST wireless sensor networks are to be replaced by Artificial Intelligence and the "proactive thought police", drones overhead, illegal immigrants in UN Soldier uniforms with blue helmets and FEMA detention processing centers.

articles.title: AI: The Good, the Bad and the…Woah
articles.author: Donna Hancock
articles.summary: It takes 14 years to reap the productivity gains from a typical New Tech adoption cycle. The malicious uses of AI are already in full bloom. Richard Bonugli and I discuss the good and the bad in AI in our new podcast/video. It will take 5 to 10 years to sort the wheat from the chaff.

articles.title: OpenAI Says It's Making a Full Hollywood Movie Using AI
articles.author: Victor Tangermann
articles.summary: OpenAI has teamed up with production companies in London and Los Angeles to create a feature-length animated movie made largely with artificial intelligence. The movie is called "Critterz" and is about forest creatures going on an adventure. It was first dreamed up by OpenAI creative specialist Chad Nelson three years ago. The goal is to cut the production time from three years to just nine months. The budget of the feature is less than $30 million, which is substantially less than other animated films.

articles.title: AP Technology SummaryBrief at 4:13 p.m. EDT
articles.summary: At least 17 people were killed during protests in Kathmandu, Nepal. Undersea cable cuts in the Red Sea have disrupted internet access in Asia and the Mideast. Warner Bros. sues the AI company Midjourney for copyright infringement. Google was hit with a $3.5 billion fine from the European Union in ad-tech antitrust case.

articles.title: Enhanced Surveillance Cameras with AI: A Path to a Crime-Free Future?
articles.summary: The idea that technology can deter crime is taking on an unprecedented dimension. Some startups rely on algorithms to fill the blind spots of human surveillance. The promise of artificial intelligence surveillance seduces as much as it worries. From the failure of a burglary to the national goals, technology can be the difference between success and failure.

articles.title: Anthropic Is Hiring Researchers to Study A.I. Consciousness and Welfare
articles.author: Alexandra Tremayne-Pengelly
articles.summary: Anthropic is looking to hire a research engineer or scientist to work on its model welfare program. The salary ranges between $315,000 and $340,000. The new employee will work with Kyle Fish, Anthropic's first-ever A.I. welfare researcher. The question of whether AI models could develop consciousness has sparked debate across Silicon Valley.

articles.title: OpenAI GPT vs. Google Gemini: the High-Stakes Battle Shaping the Future of A.I.
articles.author: New York Observer
articles.summary: GPT and Gemini set the pace as rivals race to keep up in the A.I. market. OpenAI's GPT and Google's Gemini have different visions for the technology's role in society and are competing in a high-stakes race to build the leading model.

articles.title: Surveillance Cameras Doped to Ai: the Solution for a Crime-Free Future?
articles.summary: The idea that technology can deter crime is taking on an unprecedented dimension. Some startups rely on algorithms to fill the blind spots of human surveillance. The promise of artificial intelligence surveillance seduces as much as it worries. From the failure of a burglary to the national goals, technology can be the difference between success and failure.

articles.title: What Are the 10 Top Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stocks to Buy Right Now? @themotleyfool #stocks $NVDA $AVGO $MSFT $GOOGL $ASML $TSM $AMZN $META $GOOG $TTD $SOUN
articles.summary: Investing in the companies powering artificial intelligence (AI) models is a smart move. AI hyperscalers are spending billions on data centers and recouping some of that investment by renting out computing power. There are numerous AI-related companies in the market.

articles.title: Another View: Trump's extreme anti-labor policies could determine the effect of AI on jobs
articles.author: Mark Weisbrot
articles.summary: The current government's agenda for labor will have an influence on AI development in the U.S. President Donald Trump praised Elon Musk lavishly for telling his workers that he would fire them if they went on strike. Ronald Reagan fired 11,000 air traffic controllers who had gone on strike in 1981. Trump is aiming to finish the job. The board of the NLRB has been rendered powerless because Trump fired the board chair, Gwynne Wilcox, leaving it with two members. Trump canceled union contracts for 400,000 federal workers in August.

articles.title: Could AI Lift Up Workers in an Unsung Profession?
articles.author: Vilas S. Dhar
articles.summary: There are 4.3 million home health and personal care aides in the U.S. today. The number of Americans aged 65 and over will increase by almost 50% in the coming decades, from 58 million in 2022 to 82 million by 2050. The demand for home health care workers will boom. The jobs are hard and poorly paid, with low reimbursement rates from Medicare and Medicaid. The median pay is $16.78 an hour, and 1 in 4 home workers live below the poverty line. With the right investments, AI could boost productivity and lift wages, improve working conditions and create a better path for career progression.

articles.title: Light-based chip can boost power efficiency of AI tasks up to 100-fold
articles.summary: A team at the University of Florida has developed a new computer chip that uses light instead of electricity to perform one of the most power-intensive parts of artificial intelligence. Using light dramatically cuts the power needed to perform these tasks, with efficiency 10 or 100 times that of current chips. The prototype chip classified handwritten digits with about 98% accuracy.

articles.title: Can AI Really Replace Humans In Real World Jobs? This New Study Says Not Yet.
articles.author: Michael Levanduski
articles.summary: Researchers simulated a company with AI agents as employees to see how well they would complete common tasks. The AI agents didn't live up to the hype. Claude-3.5-Sonnet is the clear winner across all models but it only manages to complete 24% of the total tasks and achieves a score of 34.4% taking into account partial completion credits.

articles.title: GPT-5 Thinking in ChatGPT (aka Research Goblin) is shockingly good at search
articles.summary: 'Don't use chatbots as search engines' was great advice for several years. I wrote about how good OpenAI's o3 was at using its Bing-backed search tool back in the past.    .   i   in this article.

articles.title: UNF launches free AI for Work and Life certificate
articles.author: Chase Bunker
articles.summary: UNF launches free AI for Work and Life certificate program. Registration for the course opens today. The eight-week, non-credit program starts September 25 and is online and on-demand. If completed by December 31, the certificate will cost $249, but the course modules will remain free and available to the public.

articles.title: Colleges Race To Prepare Students For The AI Workplace
articles.author: Samantha Walravens
articles.summary: As entry-level jobs vanish, universities scramble to close the GenAI skills gap. This fall, the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania will launch both an undergraduate concentration and an MBA major in AI for Business. San Diego State University has partnered with OpenAI to provide every student with free access to ChatGPT Plus.

articles.title: Raymond James Hires David Solganik as Head of AI Strategy
articles.author: Raymond James Financial
articles.summary: David Solganik has been appointed as head of AI strategy at Raymond James. The focus is on delivering data-driven insights, enhancing service models and developing secure, scalable applications that empower financial advisors, investment bankers and home office associates to serve clients with greater efficiency and impact.

articles.title: DeSantis Announces ‘Individual Bill of Rights' to Protect Floridians From AI
articles.summary: Gov. Ron DeSantis is working on an AI individual bill of rights to protect Floridians from negative impacts from generative AI technology. He also wants to protect children from the technology, particularly as the technology to create 'deep fake' pornography from victims' photos continues to evolve.

articles.title: Google's AI Mode Expands to Five New Languages: Hindi, Japanese, Korean
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: Google's AI-powered translation capabilities are becoming increasingly accessible globally. Google has expanded its advanced AI mode within Google Translate to include five new languages: Hindi, Japanese, Korean, Thai, and Indonesian. The update significantly enhances translation accuracy and nuance for millions of users worldwide.

articles.title: Mary Jeanne Vincent, Career Talk: AI and your job search
articles.author: Monterey Herald
articles.summary: This week I attended a workshop on using Artificial Intelligence to help English language learners improve their literacy skills. It reminded me of all the ways AI is used by companies and job candidates to find the right match. Since the invention of computers, people don't want to talk to a bot.

articles.title: Google Engineer: Mastering AI is key to the next decade of engineering
articles.author: Shubhangi Chowdhury
articles.summary: Harsh Varshney works as a machine learning software engineer at Google. He wrote a piece for Business Insider about how artificial intelligence is reshaping the tech industry. He believes the future of software will be shaped by engineers who master the duality of treating AI as both the raw material they build with and the intelligent tool that builds alongside them.

articles.title: Explaining AI: Tech Vendors Are From Mars, Lawyers Are From Venus… Or Vice Versa
articles.author: Joe Patrice
articles.summary: There's a big debate in the legal tech space about so-called 'Agentic AI' tools. Plat4orm and Lumen Advisory Group just released a report to help translate technobabble to legalese: From Hours to Outcomes: The Legal Tech Executive Playbook for Value Creation in the AI Era. It's the first in a series of planned playbooks.

articles.title: DeSantis Announces ‘Individual Bill of Rights' to Protect Floridians From AI
articles.author: Jacob Burg
articles.summary: New legal protections are coming to Florida to counter the potential harms of artificial intelligence. Gov. Ron DeSantis is working on an 'artificial intelligence individual bill of rights' to protect Floridians from negative impacts from generative AI technology, he said.

articles.title: DeSantis Signals ‘Individual Bill of Rights' to Protect Floridians From AI
articles.summary: New legal protections are coming to Florida to counter the potential harms of artificial intelligence. Gov. Ron DeSantis is working on an 'artificial intelligence individual bill of rights' to protect Floridians from negative impacts from generative AI technology, he said.

articles.title: Cognition AI defies turbulence with a $400M raise at $10.2B valuation
articles.author: Rebecca Bellan
articles.summary: Cognition AI, the startup behind AI coding agent Devin, has raised $400 million. Founders Fund, the Peter Thiel-backed VC, led the latest round. In July, Cognition acquired AI coding startup Windsurf. Google poached the CEO, co-founder, and research leads from the company. The company laid off 30 employees last month and offered buyouts to 200 others.

articles.title: Google's AI Mode adds 5 new languages including Hindi, Japanese, and Korean
articles.author: Jagmeet Singh
articles.summary: Google is expanding AI Mode to five new languages. The update follows last month's rollout of the AI-powered experience to 180 new markets in English. AI Mode is Google's answer to AI search platforms including Perplexity and OpenAI's ChatGPT Search. The feature utilizes a customized version of Gemini 2.5, featuring multimodal and reasoning capabilities.

articles.title: Google Details Exactly How Many Prompts You Can Use With Gemini Free
articles.author: Imad Khan
articles.summary: Gemini AI chatbot has a 24-hour context window for free and 1 million tokens for Pro and Ultra tiers. Free users have up to five prompts on the 2.5 Pro model a day. Subscription tiers have 100 and 500 prompts per day. For Deep Think, free members are allowed five reports a day with the lighter 2. 5 Flash model. For AI Pro and AI Ultra, users can call 200 reports per day, and for audio overviews, up to 20 overviews. Video generation using Google's Veo 3 model is unavailable for free users.

articles.title: Letter: AI boosters exaggerate benefits, ignore costs
articles.author: Letter To The Editor
articles.summary: U.S. Rep. Rob Bresnahan is promoting data center projects in NEPA. The tech industry openly admits it's the AI that requires huge data center campuses. Backups to the cloud take minuscule processing compared to what's needed for Large Language Model type AI companions that flatter users or for chatbots that conjure up fake citation footnotes.

articles.title: Edo Liberty explores the missing link in enterprise AI at Disrupt 2025
articles.author: Tech Crunch
articles.summary: TC Disrupt 2025 will discuss the difference between knowledge and intelligence in AI at a panel discussion on AI at TC Disrupt 25.      Â   for more information visit: www.tcrdisrupt2525.com/aiparty.

articles.title: From Bookmarks to Brainpower: Pikurate Opens Beta for Personalized Chatbot Builder
articles.author: Get News
articles.summary: Pikurate has launched the open beta of its hyper-personalized chatbot builder. The platform is designed to take simple saved links and transform them into intelligent conversations. It's powered by a proprietary Knowledge Management System (KMS). It processes many types of digital content.

articles.title: "Once Everything": Why Most Ai Strategies Show Mainly Disorientation
articles.summary: Kristina Bonitz is the Managing Founder of the consulting company Serotonin. She writes in her new Talking Heads column that strategy is the biggest missing element in the current AI visions of the industry. She points out that whitepapers on artificial intelligence read themselves like an all-you-can-eat menu.

articles.title: Thread by @alterego_io on Thread Reader App
articles.summary: Alterego is the world's first near-telepathic wearable that enables silent communication at the speed of thought. It passively detects the downstream signals your brain sends to your speech system, before words are spoken aloud. It captures only what you intend to say. Alterego makes AI an extension of the human mind.

articles.title: New Webcast Series by AI/R Company Subsidiary Everymind Highlights Real-World Use Cases of ...
articles.author: Everymind
articles.summary: Transform AI was created by Everymind, a subsidiary of AI/R Company, in partnership with Salesforce. Transform AI is presented as a series of interview-style episodes featuring specialists and leaders from Everymind's client brands. Success stories are explored in detail and shed light on the development process.

articles.title: SCAD LAUNCHES NEW APPLIED AI DEGREE AND MINOR
articles.author: Savannah College
articles.summary: Savannah College of Art and Design announces a new Bachelor of Design in Applied AI for the 2025-26 academic year. The degree program is designed for students to gain the skills to imagine, prototype, and direct how AI functions and how people interact with it.

articles.title: OpenAI GPT vs. Google Gemini: the High-Stakes Battle Shaping the Future of A.I.
articles.author: Victor Dey
articles.summary: The race to build the leading A.I. model has narrowed into a high-stakes duel between OpenAI's GPT and Google's Gemini. Apple is reportedly preparing to integrate Gemini into its digital assistant Siri. Meta uses both models in its apps. Anthropic's Claude commands a 32 percent market share in compliance-heavy and coding-intensive sectors.

articles.title: Artificial Intelligence at Work: an Ally to Tame
articles.author: Journal Le Nord
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is becoming increasingly important in professional circles. Simona Gandabur, director of the AI security studio at Mila, says that AI must be seen as a tool that allows us to speed up some of our work and make us more efficient.

articles.title: AI is shaking up call centers, but they aren't hanging up on human agents yet
articles.author: The Los Angeles Times
articles.summary: Armen Kirakosian used to work as a call center agent nearly 10 years ago. Thanks to artificial intelligence, he no longer has to write notes for each call he handled, as he had to physically write them for each one. He thinks A.I. has taken the human element out of the job.

articles.title: AI & Publishers: Value, Challenges & Future Strategies
articles.summary: According to WAN-IFRA report, 75% of publishers are seeing significant efficiency improvements thanks to artificial intelligence. The next wave of AI adoption in publishing will focus on efficiency and personalization. It will also focus on hyper-local news generation and advanced fact-checking.
